page.title: 10ST. PETERS CHURCH
page.content: There has reputedly been a church on this site since late Roman times.Then there was a Saxon church (700 A.D). The present building is essentially Norman dating from around 1180.Built of local flint and clunchstone,the church has examples of various types o architecture to 1880.The church has 8 bells,one of the finest sets in the country.It also holds a set of death helmets.On a pillar near the west door is graffiti probably dating from the Reformation, stating the Pope is a knave.As well as monuments to local land-owning families the church also holds monuments to Paul Wentworth, the Elizabethan politician,and William Wyndham Grenville,Prime Minister to George III.
